Package com.purnendu.quizo.utilities

Class NetworkListener

java.lang.Object
android.content.BroadcastReceiver
com.purnendu.quizo.utilities.NetworkListener
public class NetworkListener extends android.content.BroadcastReceiver
A BroadcastReceiver that listens for network connectivity changes and notifies registered listeners. This class manages the display and dismissal of an AlertDialog to inform the user about network disconnection.

It requires an Activity context to properly display UI-related elements like AlertDialog and to ensure UI operations run on the main thread.

To use this class, register an instance of it in your Activity's onResume() or onStart() method using an IntentFilter for ConnectivityManager.CONNECTIVITY_ACTION, and unregister it in onPause() or onStop() to prevent memory leaks.

Version:
2.0.1
Author:
Purnendu Guha

  • Constructor Details

    • NetworkListener

      public NetworkListener(android.app.Activity activity, NetworkListener.NetworkChangeListener networkChangeListener)
      Constructs a new NetworkListener.
      Parameters:
      activity - The Activity context that will host the network listener. This is crucial for displaying UI elements like dialogs.
      networkChangeListener - The NetworkListener.NetworkChangeListener instance to notify of network connectivity changes.

  • Method Details

    • onReceive

      public void onReceive(android.content.Context context, android.content.Intent intent)
      Called when the BroadcastReceiver is receiving an Intent broadcast. This method checks the current network connectivity status and triggers the appropriate callbacks on the NetworkListener.NetworkChangeListener. It also manages the display and dismissal of the network disconnected dialog.
      Specified by:
      onReceive in class android.content.BroadcastReceiver
      Parameters:
      context - The Context in which the receiver is running.
      intent - The Intent being received.

    • dismissNetworkDisconnectedDialog

      public void dismissNetworkDisconnectedDialog()
      Dismisses the currently displayed network disconnected AlertDialog, if it is showing. This operation is performed on the UI thread and clears the dialog reference.
